definition: Elements with properties intermediate between metals and nonmetals, often used as semiconductors

positive_examples: Silicon wafers are essential components in computer chips and solar panels
Arsenic contamination in groundwater poses serious health risks to communities
Germanium's semiconductor properties make it valuable for fiber optic systems
Boron compounds are used in glass manufacturing and as flame retardants
Antimony alloys improve the hardness of lead in car batteries
Tellurium gives rubber its distinctive properties when used as an additive
negative_examples: Iron ore contains high concentrations of metallic elements
Oxygen makes up about 21% of Earth's atmosphere
Gold jewelry retains its luster due to the metal's resistance to tarnishing
Chlorine gas was used as a chemical weapon in World War I
Carbon forms the backbone of all organic molecules
Helium balloons float because the gas is lighter than air
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Metals, Nonmetals, NobleGases, Halogens
